p: We included 436 children (226 [52%] boys, 210 [48%] girls) from rural communities in northern Ghana who received yellow fever vaccination as part of the Expanded Programme on Immunization between June 5, 2009, and Feb 25, 2010, and 587 children (297 [51%] boys, 290 [49%] girls) from urban communities in Mali who received vaccination between March 6, 2012, and Dec 26, 2012. The mean age at which children were vaccinated was 9·0 months (SD 0·3) in Ghana and 9·4 months (0·8) in Mali. The children provided blood samples 2·3 and 6·0 years after vaccination in Ghana and 4·5 years after vaccination in Mali ( table 1).
